div.p: P90/4250, unit 513, VPRS 3992/P inward registered correspondence, VA 475 Chief Secretary's Department, Public Record Office, Victoria.
MS written by G. Luehmann and signed by M. Melbourne, 16th June 1890

I have the honor to request, that you please to alter the Estimates for my branch for 1890/91, submitted by me on 10th April,
See M to T. Wilson, 10 April 1890. On 18 April 1890, G. Luehmann sent a telegram, now in the same file, to J. Killen at the Chief Secretary's Office: 'Eighteen pounds deducted from salary of fifth class clerk for quarters'. in regard to the salary of the 5th Class Clerk, which was erroneously put down at £182.- instead of £200.- The error arose through £18 having been deducted for rent, for which extra services are rendered. The same officer would also be entitled to an additional sum of £15.- for salary during 1889/90, deducted through the same error, and I would solicit that this amount be placed on the Supplemental Estimates.
MS annotation dated 18 June 1890: 'Baron Von Mueller will write again if he still wishes the suggestion herein carried out Saw Mr Luehmann'.
On 16 June 1890, Luehmann wrote to J. Killen at the Chief Secretary's Office: 'I shall be very thankful if you can still alter the salary of Mr Renner, 5th Class Clerk, from £182 to £200. I was always under the impression that £18 had been charged to him for rent of a room, but find now that this sum had been added to his salary in 1885/6, when he had to pay it back monthly. In 1886/7 this arrangement ceased and he only got an increment of £2.- In 1888/9 he got [obscured in p/c] £177 In 1889/90 £182, [obscured in p/c] should have had £1[4?? obscured in p/c] therefore £15 are d[ue] to him for arrears.'
